item.title: 投资者寻求印度国有企业避险价值，因抛售潮持续加剧
item.description: 孟买证券交易所国企指数有望跑赢基准的Sensex指数。【原文：A BSE gauge of state-owned firms is set to outperform the benchmark Sensex.】

item.title: 印尼债券需求跌至10个月低点，因卢比走弱
item.description: 印尼债券需求在拍卖中跌至十个月低点，因印尼盾抛售加剧且市场对该国财政状况的担忧持续存在。【原文：Demand for Indonesian bonds fell to the lowest in 10 months at an auction as a selloff in the rupiah deepened and concerns over the country’s fiscal health persisted.】

item.title: 英伟达黄仁勋计划访华，致力于重启中国市场
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋计划于1月下旬访问中国，以重启该公司人工智能芯片的关键市场。【原文：Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang is planning to travel to China in late January as he works to reopen a crucial market for his company’s artificial intelligence chips.】

item.title: 韩国李明博称韩元汇率持稳，或在两个月内趋于稳定
item.description: 韩国总统李在明表示，该国备受困扰的货币在未来两个月内可能走强并稳定在1400韩元兑1美元左右的水平。【原文：South Korea’s President Lee Jae Myung said the country’s beleaguered currency may strengthen and stabilize at around the 1,400 to a dollar level within the next two months.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚拟将养老基金海外持股比例上限设为30%
item.description: 哥伦比亚政府公布了一项法令草案，该草案将推动养老基金加大对国内经济的投资力度。【原文：The Colombian government unveiled a draft decree that would push pension funds to invest more heavily in the domestic economy.】

item.title: 日本银行股下跌，因日本国债波动加剧亏损担忧
item.description: 日本金融股下跌，因周二政府债券暴跌引发市场对贷款机构和经纪公司潜在亏损的担忧。【原文：Japan’s financial stocks declined as Tuesday’s government bond meltdown raised alarms about potential losses for lenders and brokerages.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德寻求17亿美元贷款以再融资首尔国际金融中心项目
item.description: 知情人士透露，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司正寻求一笔2.5万亿韩元（约合17亿美元）的贷款，该贷款由首尔国际金融中心提供担保。这凸显了投资者因持有滞销商业地产而面临的再融资困境。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management Ltd. is seeking a 2.5 trillion won ($1.7 billion) loan backed by Seoul’s International Finance Center, people familiar with the matter said, underscoring the refinancing squeeze facing investors stuck with unsold commercial real estate.】

item.title: 外国资金押注人工智能增长，重返印度科技股
item.description: 全球资金管理机构正重新对印度软件出口商的股票产生兴趣，这些企业正将业务重心转向人工智能领域。【原文：Global money managers are warming up to shares of Indian software exporters again, as they gear their business toward artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 尽管美元走弱、人民币升值，中国仍将汇率维持在7以下
item.description: 中国将人民币对美元的每日参考汇率定在7元以下，这表明面对美元近期走弱，央行正积极放缓人民币升值步伐。【原文：China set its daily reference rate for the yuan weaker than 7 per dollar, a sign the central bank is keen to slow the currency’s gains in the face of recent weakness in the greenback.】

item.title: 花旗称日本国债动荡风险或引发高达1300亿美元国债抛售
item.description: 花旗集团表示，日本政府债券市场波动性急剧上升可能蔓延至其他市场——尤其是美国国债市场——迫使部分投资者削减投资组合中的风险敞口。【原文：A sharp rise in volatility in Japan’s government bond market could spill over into other markets — especially US Treasuries — forcing some investors to cut back risk across portfolios, Citigroup Inc. said.】

item.title: 摩根大通英国子公司将在印度GIFT城开设分行
item.description: 摩根大通旗下子公司正于印度古吉拉特国际金融科技城（GIFT City）设立分支机构，开展股票等金融工具交易业务，成为最新一家进驻该低税枢纽的全球性银行。【原文：A unit of JPMorgan Chase & Co. is setting up a branch in India’s Gujarat International Finance Tec-City, or GIFT City, to trade equities, among other instruments, becoming the latest global bank to take advantage of the country’s low-tax hub.】

item.title: 标普警告日本消费税下调恐加剧财政恶化风险
item.description: 标普全球评级表示，高市早苗首相提出的降低食品消费税计划存在风险，可能削减日本财政收入，并从长远看损害国家财政状况，这表明该机构对此日益担忧。【原文：S&P Global Ratings said there’s a risk that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s proposed plan to cut the tax on food purchases would lower Japan’s revenues and undermine the nation’s finances in the long term, in a sign of its rising concerns.】

item.title: 印度国有炼油商BPCL引领锁定中东原油供应的行动
item.description: 印度国有炼油商巴拉特石油公司正寻求锁定长期中东原油采购协议，这最新迹象表明，作为全球第三大石油进口国的印度正逐步回归传统供应商，减少对廉价俄罗斯原油的过度依赖。【原文：Indian state-owned refiner Bharat Petroleum Corp. is seeking to lock in long-term Middle East crude purchases, in the latest sign that the world’s third-largest oil importer is edging back toward traditional suppliers and away from a heavy reliance on cheap Russian cargoes.】

item.title: 摩根大通的米歇尔称市场抛售是给特朗普的信号
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司的鲍勃·米歇尔表示，市场抛售是对特朗普政府发出的信号，要求其采取行动恢复市场平静——正如去年解放日关税引发投资者恐慌后官员们所做的那样。【原文：JPMorgan Asset Management’s Bob Michele said the selloff in markets is a message to President Donald Trump’s administration to take action to restore calm as officials did after Liberation Day tariffs rattled investors last year.】

item.title: 智利当选总统卡斯特任命内阁成员，奎罗斯出任财政部长
item.description: 智利当选总统何塞·安东尼奥·卡斯特于周二晚间公布内阁名单，任命其首席顾问、反监管斗士豪尔赫·基罗斯担任财政部长，同时放弃了为削减开支而缩减部长人数的计划。【原文：Chile’s President-elect José Antonio Kast unveiled his cabinet on Tuesday night, naming top adviser and anti-regulation crusader Jorge Quiroz as his finance chief while backing off from a cost-cutting plan to reduce the number of ministers.】

item.title: 万科修订版人民币债券扩容方案获批
item.description: 万科集团通过提高前期现金支付比例优化了原有方案，成功获得债权人支持，将人民币债券偿付期限延长一年，从而缓解了这家陷入困境的开发商面临的违约风险。【原文：China Vanke Co. won enough creditor backing to extend payments on a yuan bond for a year, after it sweetened an earlier proposal with an upfront cash payment, easing the embattled developer’s risk of an imminent default.】

item.title: 日本债券市场流动性恶化至历史最低水平，因投资者集体罢购
item.description: 日本国债市场流动性在本周抛售潮中恶化至历史最低水平，凸显出许多人认为的"买方罢工"现象，导致超长期国债收益率飙升。【原文：Liquidity in Japan’s government bond market has deteriorated to record levels amid this week’s sharp selloff, underscoring what many see as a buyers’ strike that has sent super-long yields soaring.】

item.title: 日本法院将就前首相安倍遇刺案作出判决
item.description: 日本法院即将对涉嫌2022年枪杀前首相安倍晋三的男子作出判决——这起震惊全国的凶案引发了执政党与宗教团体关系的争议。【原文：A Japanese court is set to hand down its verdict on the man accused in the fatal 2022 shooting of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe —- a crime that horrified the nation and sparked controversy over the ruling party’s ties to a religious group.】

item.title: 波普艺术、小米扩大股票回购规模，股市震荡之际
item.description: 在香港上市的几家中国大型企业正忙于回购自家股票，试图提振投资者对其股价走低的信心。【原文：Some of the biggest Chinese firms listed in Hong Kong are busy buying back their own shares, seeking to shore up investor confidence in their cooling stock prices.】

item.title: 韩国股市表现全球领先仍属"低估"，第一鹰资本如是说
item.description: 尽管韩国股市已创下历史性上涨纪录，其吸引力依然不减。据第一鹰投资管理公司分析，该国效仿日本模式推进的企业改革举措，有望为股东带来更快速的收益增长。【原文：South Korean equities remain attractive despite a record-breaking rally, with a corporate reform drive modeled on Japan’s playbook seen delivering faster gains for shareholders, according to First Eagle Investment Management.】

item.title: 韩国初步贸易数据显示芯片出口保持坚挺
item.description: 韩国出口在1月前几周加速增长，得益于半导体需求的持续强劲，而汽车出口则因美国提高关税而有所放缓。【原文：South Korea’s exports gathered pace in the first weeks of January, powered by steadfast semiconductor demand, while shipments of autos softened in the face of higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 新月资本募集32亿美元，创下最大规模信贷二级基金纪录
item.description: 新月资本集团为其一只基金募集了32亿美元资金，该基金允许其延长部分私募信贷投资的持有期限，创下迄今为止信贷二级市场专项基金的最大募资规模。【原文：Crescent Capital Group collected $3.2 billion for a fund that allows it to hold on to some of its private credit investments for longer, marking the largest raise for a vehicle dedicated to credit secondaries so far.】

item.title: 加州公务员退休系统加大对私募股权的风险投资和成长型投资力度
item.description: 美国最大的公共养老金基金——加州公共雇员退休系统正加大对快速成长型和初创企业的投资力度，这是其私募股权投资组合全面调整的一部分。【原文：California Public Employees’ Retirement System, the biggest US public pension fund, is deploying more money to fast-growing and early-stage companies as part of a broader revamp of its private equity portfolio.】

item.title: 日本40年期国债反弹，片山敦夫呼吁市场保持冷静
item.description: 日本40年期国债收益率在抛售潮中飙升至历史高位后，因财务大臣片山萨茨基呼吁市场参与者保持冷静而出现反弹。【原文：Japan’s 40-year bond rebounded after Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama called for calm among market participants following a selloff that pushed yields to all-time highs.】

item.title: 油价下跌，特朗普推动吞并格陵兰岛引发市场震荡
item.description: 油价下跌，因美国总统唐纳德·特朗普试图吞并格陵兰岛的举动引发了更广泛市场的恐慌。【原文：Oil declined as US President Donald Trump’s attempts to annex Greenland sent jitters through wider markets.】

item.title: 美国电网计划旨在加速数据中心连接
item.description: 根据PJM互联公司的一项提案，已为其设施安排新增电力容量的数据中心，将在接入美国最大电网时获得优先权。【原文：Data centers that have lined up new electricity capacity for their facilities would get priority in connecting to the largest US power grid under a proposal by PJM Interconnection LLC.】

item.title: 金价创历史新高，格陵兰危机持续恶化
item.description: 金价创下历史新高——白银价格也逼近历史峰值——因格陵兰岛危机持续恶化及日本政府债务崩盘，推升了避险资产需求。【原文：Gold rose to a record high — and silver was near an all-time peak — as the worsening crisis over Greenland and a meltdown in Japanese government debt supported haven demand.】

item.title: 投资者关注印度预算案，以期在国有企业中获取收益
item.description: 投资者正密切关注2月1日公布的预算案，以判断政府是否会重启股权出售以筹集资金支持经济增长。据此，印度国有企业股票可能延续其相对于大盘的优异表现。【原文：India’s state-run stocks may extend their outperformance versus the broader market, according to investors watching the Feb. 1 budget for signals on whether the government will revive stake sales to raise funds and support economic growth.】

item.title: 印尼盾创历史新低，干预担忧笼罩央行利率会议
item.description: 在投资者对央行独立性日益担忧的阴云笼罩下，印尼将召开今年首次货币政策会议。这种担忧已导致印尼盾汇率跌至历史最低点。【原文：Indonesia will hold its first monetary policy meeting of the year under a growing cloud of investor anxiety about the central bank’s autonomy, which has already sent the rupiah to its lowest level on record.】

item.title: 越南管道制造商蓄势待发，母公司SCG谋求交易
item.description: 越南最大上市塑料管制造商平明塑料股份有限公司（Binh Minh Plastics JSC）在泰国暹罗水泥集团（Siam Cement Pcl）的支持下，正处于乘势而上的有利位置，有望在持续增长的经济体中把握建筑业的长期上升周期。该公司首席执行官尼瓦特·阿提瓦塔南农（Niwat Athiwattananont）表示，这凸显了越南在母公司区域扩张计划中日益重要的战略地位。【原文：Vietnam’s largest listed plastic pipe maker Binh Minh Plastics JSC, backed by Thailand’s Siam Cement Pcl, is positioned to ride a prolonged construction upswing in a growing economy, underscoring the nation’s rising importance to its parent’s regional expansion plans, according to Binh Minh Chief Executive Officer Niwat Athiwattananont.】
